result.execSummary:
The defendant David S Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David S Wagner appeared by phone means incustody in another county WLC. Prosecuting Atty Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Eric Newmark in court for Defendant David S Wagner.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NE-Clerk 2:04. Ct gives status - DEF to make plea over telephone - parties indicate they wish proceed in this fashion. ADA agreement - comp. w/vic. rights. Ct DEF waives right to be in person to enter plea. PCR. Ct warrant quashed. 2:31 adj. 

SENCTENCING: 

CNT 1 - DEF pleas G. Ct accepts plea and finds DEF G, and enters JOC. Ct 9 months, $265.60, $200.00 DNA surcharge
CNT 2 - DEF pleas G. Ct accepts plea and finds DEF G, and enters JOC. Ct 9 months concurrent, $265.60, $200.00 DNA surcharge
                 Ct fine/costs to be obtained through wage assignment. Ct time served sentence. Ct rest. of $118.26 j/s w/co-defs.

CNT 3 - DRI for purposes of rest.
CNT 4 - DRI for purposes of rest.
CNT 5 - DRI for purposes of rest.
to Judge MEG from Atty Newmark datd 11-18-16
Final pre-trial on January 26, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant David S Wagner not in court. Atty Bjork appears.   Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB- Clerk. 12:21pm State req warrant. Ct auth & issued. 12:21pm adj.

Defendant David S Wagner in court with attorney John P Bjork.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 11:49am bond cont. 11:50 am adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Submitted by Atty John P. Bjork

Not to have contact with: Tashina Martinson, Lee Martinson, or Christopher Rupp.   Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.

Defendant David S Wagner in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 3:06pm Does qualify. Atty Smestad- NG pleas. Def req property seized be returned. State- will put request for items in to municipal. Atty Smestad req Def be able to appear by phone at FPT. CT grants that Def may appear by phone if just scheduling; if resolved, must appear. 3:13pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
